tweets.text:
A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

urls.title: Horror at destruction of nationally important UK river | The Wildlife Trusts
urls.description: Major damage to River Lugg in Herefordshire will be test case for Government commitment to strengthen wildlife protection.

tweets.text:
BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t

Terrible to hear about this eco-vandalism at #RiverLuggSSSI in #Herefordshire

It's a clear breach of environmental legislation, and test case for @DefraGovUK @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency enforcement

We @WildlifeTrusts will be following it very carefully https://t.co/YZpRTggpl4

Great work from all involved. #TeamSkillMill @stwater @MyNottingham @NottinghamFPA @ssemidlands @CRTEastMidlands @NottmCastle @Notts_VRU @VisitNotts @exceptionals_uk @EnvAgencyMids #BuySocial #SocEnt https://t.co/vWcUyZbVEe
did it have a scrap dealers permit, @EnvAgencyYNE waste transfer licence  and  was it insured for that purpose https://t.co/WF9M1kUz3R

@MarkAvery @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @WCL_News @GreenAllianceUK @Natures_Voice @WildlifeTrusts @Buzz_dont_tweet @Love_plants @Feargal_Sharkey Thank you for highlighting this case. @NHDCLibDems are fighting to rescue our chalkstreams incl the Ivel - Affinity know they can't keep sucking the life out of our rivers. Time to invest in reservoirs?https://t.co/Fn5KyC97UH

Counting #salmon redds in Swindale Beck today with @EnvAgencyNW. Really decent numbers, with at least 43 redds seen in the 1km stretch at the bottom of the valley, and plenty further up too. Saw loads of big fish, dead & alive. #rivers https://t.co/CJviM1ZN7n

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

tweets.text: Guardian: @EnvAgency slashes number of water pollution incident visits amid rising fears water industry is now polluting UK rivers with impunity putting the health of river users and unique ecosystems at risk https://t.co/FbjqetyRzY via @Feargal_Sharkey @bilgribs

In 2015 Storm Desmond caused devastating flooding in #Carlisle 

In 2020 we are celebrating the defences in Melbourne Park now being to a Storm Desmond Level, better protecting 1200 homes and business ahead of winter this year! https://t.co/2EvjCd3YF9

@RobGMacfarlane @silverpebble @EnvAgency Any potential fine was no doubt factored into the plan...they'll pay, if charged, eventually, wait a few years, and initiate whatever plan they had. Fines and complete restoration at their cost is the only real punishment for such wilful destruction.

Winter update: invasive Floating Pennywort 

Your sightings are still valuable, please report them - 
River Great Ouse: https://t.co/MxAmZmXuNC 
River Witham: https://t.co/jH1bfH1Ejq

@AnglianWater @EnvAgencyAnglia @EnvAgencyMids @KeepBritainTidy @CanalRiverTrust @lincsrivers https://t.co/2EDRWqzVRM

1/2: This is awful.  Vital that @NaturalEngland take swift action to investigate, prosecute and secure compensation.  As budgets have been slashed, they haven't done anything like enough of that stuff for years which might partly explain why... @DefraGovUK @RachSalv @Unchecked_UK https://t.co/fbxldLKwTP
@leeinthelakes @EnvAgencyNW @RSPBEngland @WildHaweswater @NECumbria @unitedutilities how do these numbers compare to pre- beck restoration works?
@leeinthelakes @EnvAgencyNW @WildLakeland @RSPBEngland @WildHaweswater @NECumbria @unitedutilities Excellent. How does this compare with previous years?

I've often ask the question "And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?"

Transpires we now have an answer. It's not a lot.

"The Environment Agency attended just 292 water pollution incidents, down from 1,726 during the same period in 2019". @bilgribs 

https://t.co/Hbcmxyl5pI

urls.title: Environment Agency slashes number of water pollution incident visits
urls.description: Huge drop in number of visits during Covid crisis raises concerns polluters are breaking laws with impunity

tweets.text: @bilgribs @Nickhod53168394 @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency I heard it was actually driven by their union. I don't know for sure though
